description: Part single storey/ part first floor rear extension, hip to gable conversion, front and rear dormer roof extension including 2x juliet balconies to facilitate loft conversion.
decision_conditions: By virtue of its design, size and scale, the proposed part two storey rear extension and rear dormer extension would fail to appear as a subservient addition when read against the rear elevation of the host dwelling. The proposed front dormer extension would appear as an incongruous addition that would appear out-of-keeping within the eastern side of the street scene on Cleveland Road. The proposal would therefore have a harmful impact on the character and appearance of the host dwelling and the surrounding area, contrary to the National Planning Policy Framework (2019), Policies CS8 and DM10 of the Council's Core Strategy (2012) and Policy Guidance 34 and 39 of the Council's Residential Design SPD.

This application seeks a non-material amendment to facilitate the introduction of 3 louvres (as clouded)  measuring 150mm x 150mm to tumble dryers to ventilate to atmosphere to be non-material and as such, it is recommended that a S96A application for a non-material amendment be granted subject to the additional condition belowIt is considered that the proposed amendment, taken in combination with other amendments previously approved, would be non-material.

You are required to complete the 'Determining whether a Development may be CIL Liable Planning Application Additional Information Requirement form'.
